item.title: 报告称，关税对低收入美国人的打击将大于对最富有美国人的打击
item.description: 根据美国税收与经济政策研究所的一项分析，唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税措施将有效导致低收入家庭的税收增加，比美国富裕家庭的税收高出三倍多。【原文：President Donald Trump’s tariffs would effectively cause a tax increase for low-income families that is more than three times higher than what wealthier Americans would pay, according to an analysis from the Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy.】

item.title: 据说保健营销公司 Klick 正在探索股权出售事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，健康产业数字营销机构 Klick Health 正在探索出售少数股权。【原文：Klick Health, a digital marketing agency for the health industry, is exploring the sale of a minority stake, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Meta 裁掉现实实验室部门 100 多名员工
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的人士透露，Meta Platforms Inc.正在裁员，其现实实验室（Reality Labs）部门主要负责开发虚拟现实和可穿戴设备，裁员人数超过 100 人。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. is laying off more than 100 people across its Reality Labs division focused on creating virtual reality and wearable devices, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普的贸易冲击让世界陷入可怕的 "不确定性
item.description: 本周，世界各国的财政首脑齐聚华盛顿，近距离观察唐纳德-特朗普总统彻底改革全球经济秩序的努力是如何动摇市场、侵蚀增长的。【原文：The world’s finance chiefs flocked to Washington this week to see up close how President Donald Trump’s effort to overhaul the global economic order is shaking markets and eroding growth.】

item.title: Alphabet 谷歌搜索广告销售额超预期
item.description: 受搜索广告业务持续强劲的推动，谷歌母公司 Alphabet Inc.【原文：Google parent Alphabet Inc. reported first-quarter revenue and profit that exceeded analysts’ expectations, buoyed by continued strength in its search advertising business.】

item.title: T-Mobile 新无线客户流失后股价暴跌
item.description: 在 T-Mobile US Inc. 公布第一季度新增无线电话用户数低于分析师预期后，该公司股价下跌。【原文：T-Mobile US Inc. shares fell after the company reported fewer new wireless phone subscribers than analysts expected in the first quarter.】

item.title: 让雇主支付低于最低工资的法律
item.description:
今天的 Big Take 播客：14(c)计划的争论内幕，该计划允许美国雇主向一些残疾工人支付最低以下的工资。【原文：

On today’s Big Take podcast: inside the debate over 14(c), a program that allows US employers to pay some workers with disabilities a subminimum wage.

】

item.title: 英特尔发布令人失望的业绩预测，计划裁减更多职位
item.description: 在新任首席执行官陈立武的领导下试图东山再起的芯片制造商英特尔公司（Intel Corp.【原文：Intel Corp., the chipmaker attempting a comeback under new Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan, gave a weak forecast for the current period and said it’s cutting workers to bring costs in line with the business’s smaller size.】

item.title: 人工智能消费热潮从训练模型转向运行模型
item.description: 最大的云计算公司正在重新思考如何投资人工智能开发。但首先...【原文：The biggest cloud computing firms are rethinking how they invest in AI development. But first…】

item.title: 移动 Siri 几周后，苹果将剥离人工智能主管的秘密机器人部门
item.description: 苹果公司将把其秘密的机器人部门从其人工智能主管的指挥下撤出，这是该公司因人工智能方面的困境而进行的最新调整。【原文：Apple Inc. will remove its secret robotics unit from the command of its artificial intelligence chief, the latest shake-up in response to the company’s AI struggles.】

item.title: 1200 亿美元资金外流后，富兰克林加强对 Wamco 的风险监督
item.description: 富兰克林资源公司（Franklin Resources Inc. ）正在加强对旗下 Western Asset Management Co.【原文：Franklin Resources Inc. is asserting more control over its Western Asset Management Co. unit, which racked up more than $120 billion of redemptions after revealing an investigation into its onetime star bond trader.】

item.title: 默克集团即将达成收购 SpringWorks Therapeutics 的交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，默克公司即将达成收购 SpringWorks Therapeutics 公司的交易。【原文：Merck KGaA is nearing a deal to acquire SpringWorks Therapeutics Inc., people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Equinox 提高收购要约甜度后 Calibre Mining 股价创 13 年新高
item.description: Equinox Gold Corp.在投资者投票表决前几小时提高了对这家加拿大黄金生产商的收购要约，Calibre Mining Corp.的股价因此跃升至13年来的最高价。【原文：Calibre Mining Corp. shares jumped to their highest price in 13 years after Equinox Gold Corp. sweetened its takeover offer for the Canadian gold producer hours before investors were to vote on the deal.】

item.title: 特朗普利用紧急状态法征收关税。这合法吗？
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易关税激怒了金融市场，引起了世界各国领导人的强烈不满，并引发了美国经济衰退的幽灵。这种反弹最终促使特朗普将一些最具惩罚性的关税暂停 90 天。尽管美国宪法赋予国会在制定进口关税方面的最后决定权，但美国总统的一举一动都在强调他在发号施令。【原文：President Donald Trump’s trade tariffs have roiled financial markets, prompted an outcry from world leaders and raised the specter of a US recession. The blowback eventually prompted Trump to pause some of the most punishing tariffs for 90 days. With every move, the US president underscores that he is calling the shots, though the US Constitution gives Congress the last word in setting import duties.】

item.title: 据说有望在伦敦上市的 NewDay 吸引了贝恩、Pimco 和 KKR
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由 Cinven 和 CVC Capital Partners Plc 拥有的英国消费信贷提供商 NewDay 吸引了包括太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co.【原文：NewDay, the British consumer credit provider owned by Cinven and CVC Capital Partners Plc, has attracted interest from alternative asset managers including Pacific Investment Management Co. and KKR & Co., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普称有望与挪威就关税达成协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在与到访的挪威首相约纳斯-加尔-斯托尔会晤时表示，他有信心能够与挪威达成贸易协议，但他并没有提出在不做出让步的情况下削减他的 "对等 "关税。【原文：US President Donald Trump expressed confidence he would be able to reach an agreement on trade with Norway during a meeting with visiting Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store, but stopped short of offering to roll back his “reciprocal” tariffs without concessions.】

item.title: 鸡蛋价格推动更多美国人开始养鸡
item.description: 全国性的鸡蛋短缺和随之而来的价格飙升促使许多美国人开始尝试自己养鸡。【原文：The nationwide egg shortage and subsequent surge in prices is pushing many Americans to try their hand at raising a chicken flock of their own.】

item.title: Authentic Brands 集团考虑收购 Guess?
item.description: Authentic Brands Group Inc.正考虑对美国服装公司 Guess?Inc.【原文：Authentic Brands Group Inc. is considering launching a rival takeover bid for American clothing company Guess? Inc., people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 贝森特认为下周美韩将达成贸易 "谅解
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周四在两国会谈后表示，美国和韩国最快可能在下周就贸易问题达成 "谅解协议"。【原文：The US and South Korea could reach an “agreement of understanding” on trade as soon as next week, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Thursday, following talks between the two nations.】

item.title: Meta、谷歌在法庭上遭到重击，左翼与右翼罕见地团结一致
item.description: 本周，两家科技巨头 Meta Platforms 公司和 Alphabet 公司在同一联邦法院的不同房间里接受了反垄断审判。这反映了两党对惩罚它们的罕见热情，其努力跨越了特朗普和拜登政府。【原文：Two tech giants — Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet Inc. — were stung hard in antitrust trials in different rooms of the same federal courthouse this week. It’s a reflection of rare bipartisan enthusiasm for punishing them, efforts that spanned the Trump and Biden administrations.】

item.title: 马莎百货网络事件继续造成混乱
item.description: 周四，英国零售商玛莎百货（Marks & Spencer）因网络安全事件面临持续中断。【原文：British retailer Marks & Spencer was facing continued disruption on Thursday following a cybersecurity incident.】

item.title: 肯尼亚中央银行 "积极考虑 "购买黄金
item.description: 肯尼亚央行行长表示，肯尼亚正在考虑将黄金纳入其储备，以使其持有的外汇多样化，而不仅仅局限于美元和其他货币。【原文：Kenya is considering adding gold to its reserves to diversify its foreign exchange holdings beyond the US dollar and other currencies, according to the country’s central bank governor.】

item.title: 哈佛大学洽谈出售 10 亿美元私募股权
item.description: 哈佛大学的捐赠基金正在就出售大约 10 亿美元的私募股权基金股权进行深入谈判，而此时学校正面临着唐纳德-特朗普的威胁和非流动资产回报市场疲软所带来的财务不确定性和压力。【原文：Harvard University’s endowment is in advanced talks to sell roughly $1 billion of private equity fund stakes, at a time when the school faces financial uncertainty and pressure from Donald Trump’s threats and a sluggish market for returns on illiquid assets.】

item.title: 卡尼称加拿大有等待美国贸易协议的筹码
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）表示，加拿大不需要与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）迅速达成协议，他认为加拿大在谈判中有足够的筹码，必要时可以等待更长的时间。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada does not need to reach a quick deal with US President Donald Trump, arguing his country has enough leverage in the negotiations to wait longer if necessary.】

item.title: 加拿大 IPO 银行家欢呼 "革命性 "的筹资新规
item.description: 投资银行家们对加拿大证券监管机构采取的措施表示赞赏，这些措施使首次公开发行股票以及发行后的融资变得更加容易。【原文：Investment bankers are applauding steps taken by Canada’s securities regulators to make it easier to do initial public offerings, and to raise money afterwards.】

item.title: 南非国务卿戈东瓦纳表示不会因增值税调头而辞职
item.description: 南非财政部长伊诺克-戈东瓦纳（Enoch Godongwana）表示，他认为没有理由辞职，因为他在增税提议上的转折可能导致南非联合政府破裂。【原文：South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana said he sees no reason to resign following his U-turn on a proposed tax increase that threatened to rupture the nation’s coalition government.】

item.title: 首席执行官警告关税将使日常用品更加昂贵
item.description: 首席执行官们警告说，由于他们将关税和商品成本转嫁给购物者，从 Kit Kats、尿布到汽车的价格都将上涨。【原文：CEOs are warning that the price of everything from Kit Kats and diapers to cars will go up as they pass on tariff and commodity costs to shoppers.】

item.title: 特朗普的播客策略变得小众而友好
item.description:
【原文：

Meanwhile, top Democrats are starting to engage more with the broad, mass-market podcasts 

】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会解决了针对将特朗普媒体上市的 SPAC 首席执行官的诉讼
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会正在解决针对空头支票公司前首席执行官的民事欺诈诉讼，该公司曾帮助唐纳德-特朗普的社交媒体公司上市。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission is resolving a civil fraud suit against the former chief executive of the blank-check firm that helped bring Donald Trump’s social media company public.】

item.title: 巴拿马总统在矿山谈判前煽动民族主义情绪
item.description: 巴拿马总统若泽-劳尔-穆利诺（Jose Raul Mulino）在其政府准备与运营商第一量子矿业有限公司（First Quantum Minerals Ltd.）谈判重启铜矿的可能性之际，对该国一座已关闭的铜矿发表了民族主义言论。【原文：Panama’s President Jose Raul Mulino stepped up nationalist rhetoric toward a shuttered copper mine in the country as his administration prepares to negotiate a potential restart with operator First Quantum Minerals Ltd.】
